traditional_medicine.historical_use: William Withering described its effect on 'dropsy' in 1785; one of the most important discoveries in pharmacy

description: WARNING: Highly toxic! Only use pharmaceutical preparations!
evidence_summary: Standard medication for heart failure and atrial fibrillation; well-researched, but now partially replaced by more modern drugs

side_effects.description: Nausea, vomiting, cardiac arrhythmias, visual disturbances (yellow vision)

overdose.description: Antidote: Digitalis antibodies (Fab fragments). Immediate intensive care treatment required.

dosage_notes: ONLY UNDER MEDICAL SUPERVISION! Therapeutic range extremely narrow. NEVER use the plant yourself!
patient_counseling_points: All parts of the plant are highly toxic!
If poisoning is suspected: Call emergency services!
